# 2018 Outer Critics Circle Awards

| venue = Sardi's
| hosts = Jenn Colella, Jim Dale, Christine Ebersole and Martha Plimpton
}}
The 2018 Outer Critics Circle Awards winners were announced on May 7, 2018, recognizing excellence in Broadway and Off-Broadway productions during the 2017–18 season. Nominations were announced on April 24, 2018, with SpongeBob SquarePants receiving the most nominations with 11, while Harry Potter and the Cursed Child followed with 10 nominations. For Off-Broadway, Desperate Measures was the most-nominated musical with seven nominations, while Cost of Living was the most-nominated play, with four nominations.
Harry Potter and the Cursed Child took home the most awards, with six including Outstanding New Broadway Play, with My Fair Lady taking home five, including Outstanding Revival of a Musical.
Awards and nominations
The awards winners were announced on May 7, 2018, with an awards ceremony at Sardi's on May 24, 2018, with presenters Jenn Colella, Jim Dale, Christine Ebersole and Martha Plimpton.
While Harry Potter and the Cursed Child and My Fair Lady took home the most awards, with six and five, respectively, SpongeBob SquarePants, the most nominated production, won four, including Outstanding New Broadway Musical. For Off-Broadway productions, Admissions won Outstanding New Off-Broadway Play and Desperate Measures took home Outstanding New Off-Broadway Musical, as both productions' sole win.
It was also notable for a tie in the category of Outstanding Director of a Musical, with wins for both Tina Landau for SpongeBob SquarePants and Bartlett Sher for My Fair Lady.
